**The Supreme Cavernous Divine and Abyssal Divine Incantations for Healing Illnesses – Oral Petition Chapter**

Sound the celestial drum thrice to open the incense burner.

Supreme Mysterious Origin, Five Numinous Venerable Lord, Three *Qi* Orthodox Deities—hasten to summon within us, your servants: the True Officials of the Five Corporeal Forms, the Three-and-Five Merit Officers, the Upper and Lower Grand Masters, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Incense-Bearing Envoys, the Message-Transmitting Celestial Maidens, and the Document-Holding Lads—twenty-four each.

The Ministers and Vice Ministers, the Messengers and Lesser Clerks—one hundred twenty thousand.

We hereby report to the Supreme Three Heavens’ Mysterious Origin Great Dao Lord and the Ten Directions’ Supreme Ones.

As we now enter the oratory and burn incense to present this oral petition, we pray for healing and disaster dispelling, that the Eight Directions’ Orthodox *Qi* may enter our bodies, allowing our supplications to ascend directly before the Jade Emperor’s throne.

Next, bow to the four directions, beginning in the west and ending in the east, sounding the celestial drum thirty-six times.

Then, kneel to dispatch the officers and soldiers:

From within us, your servants, we reverently send forth:
- The Transcendent Numinous High Officials and Direct Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand each.
- The Orthodox Unity Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Three-in-One Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The *Qi*-Hastening Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Illness-Healing Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Lesser Physician Clerks—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Upper, Middle, and Lower Section Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand each.
- The Upper, Middle, and Lower Section Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand each.
- The High Chariot Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Crimson Chariot Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Primordial True Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Primordial Spirit Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Yang Spirit Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Yin Spirit Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The High Chariot Governors—two hundred forty thousand.
- The *Qi*-Seizing and *Qi*-Consuming Clerks, Ghost-Seizing and Ghost-Consuming Clerks, Malevolence-Seizing and Malevolence-Consuming Clerks, Calamity-Seizing and Calamity-Consuming Clerks, Essence-Seizing and Essence-Consuming Clerks, Misfortune-Seizing and Misfortune-Consuming Clerks, Illness-Seizing and Illness-Consuming Clerks—six hundred thousand each.
- The Supreme Healing Jade Maidens and the Ten Directions’ Overseers—seven hundred thousand each.

Let all who emerge don their solemn attire, crowns and pendants, and arrange their majestic regalia. Let them array their processional insignia, rank upon rank, standing in solemn formation.

Before, behind, left, and right of us, your servants, let each wield blades outward, ordering weapons and staves. Let a thousand voices chant in unison, ten thousand in harmony.

Three paces from us, let them regard one another, awaiting the Direct Merit Officers—each wearing a Heaven-Reaching Crown, clad in black single robes, girded with Dragon-Tiger Talismans, and wielding Vajra Halberds—seven hundred twenty thousand.

Before us, the Orthodox Unity Merit Officers—each wearing a Vermilion Yang Headband, clad in crimson ceremonial robes, girded with Heaven-Reaching Spears, and wielding Luminous Swords—seven hundred eighty thousand.

Behind us, the Soaring Heaven Great Generals—each wearing a Five-Colored Crown, clad in brocade armor, girded with Hundred-Forged Blades, and wielding Nine-Bend Blades—four hundred thousand.

To our left, the Fierce Horizontal Great Generals—each wearing a Dark Yin Crimson Headband, clad in Seven-Jade Black Robes, and girded with Hundred-Forged Black Halberds—nine hundred thousand.

To our right, the Merit Officers above, the Registrars below, the Heavenly Officials to the left, the Earthly Officials to the right, the Civil Officials before, and the Martial Officials behind.

The Five-Colored Banners flutter in majestic order. They ride chariots and mount steeds, dragon and tiger cavalry. Those on foot and in palanquins proceed in ranks.

The Azure Hosts in the east, the White Hosts in the west, the Crimson Hosts in the south, the Black Hosts in the north, and the Yellow Hosts at the center.

The shield-bearers advance, the archers follow. The Bandit Officers to the left, the Guardians to the right. Drums and bells resound, horns echo—deep and thunderous.

The Five Marchmounts’ armies patrol the streets. The Four Seas’ armies blockade the nine provinces. The armies of Kunlun’s Jade Capital overflow. The voids within and without respond in unison.

Command the various Ghost Kings to order the demonic soldiers, each to slay the ghosts.

Now, from [so-and-so] prefecture, county, village, and household, [so-and-so] man or woman petitions:

Descendants of ancient officials, common folk by custom, we have, through a thousand years’ fate, entered the Daoist gate. As latter-day followers, we submit to the Great Dao, privately rejoicing in its grace.

Yet, through unclear devotion, we have incurred *qi*-afflictions and attracted misfortune. Of late, our households suffer ill fortune, our dwellings harbor calamities—ten thousand miseries, countless disasters.

Moreover, [so-and-so] has, for [so many] months and days, suddenly fallen ill, with symptoms [as described], fearing survival is unlikely.

We have heard that the Dao can reverse death and restore life. Those who surrender to it are never left unaided. Petitions that reach the throne are never unanswered. The grace lies with the Supreme Ones; the matter rests with the Overseers.

We, your foolish servants, uphold the Three Caverns’ decrees, unable to bear the urgency of the suffering before us. Great and small, high and low—we kowtow, beat our cheeks, and plead in earnest, seeking deliverance.

Unable to endure the sight of this mortal’s desperate plight, like a candle in the wind, we prostrate ourselves, presenting this oral petition once, laid upon the jade table before us.

As the petitioner’s words are recorded, we humbly submit each matter. We dare not transgress the rites, though much remains to be said.

May it be that today, the Direct Talismanic Envoys who hold the case, the Overseers, the Guiding Attendants, the Left and Right Announcers, the officials in charge of affairs, the Upper and Lower Plain Women, the Merit Scribes, the Left Millet and Right Sacrificial Officers, and the Case-Holding Clerks—seven hundred thousand each—ascend together with this petition, facing the Celestial Courts, that every matter may be judged and decided, every document transmitted and delivered, all clearly and distinctly.

May the Merit Scribes and minor clerks, once assembled, descend to heed the oral petition of your servants. When the matters are concluded, may each return to their palaces and resume their positions as before. Let the exchange of officers and soldiers be commanded by the Celestial Courts. May every matter be judged without delay; let no stagnation occur. Those who cause delay shall be the first to face punishment.

May the timing be opportune for transmission, allowing the Dao’s qi to flow downward, covering the mortal in need. May the afflicted recover swiftly, and may those who recover bring merit to the officers and soldiers. Let their merit be reported to the Celestial Courts, their ranks elevated, and their positions advanced. May all inform one another.

From the officials above to the spirits within heaven and earth, may the ghosts afflicting the sick be seized and driven away one by one. May the illness be cured, and may the Jade Maidens of healing attend to them. May every action be carried out in accordance with the ailment, and medicine dispensed as needed. May the inspectors below verify the treatment, addressing each condition according to its symptoms, ensuring clear recovery, with merit and reward for each cure.

Should any among the myriad ranks bear resentment toward the officials, soldiers, or healing officers, let them be furnished with treasured needles, medicinal tools, and the company of Master Lu and Bian Que, leading the Kings of Medicine of the world, along with three hundred sixty Healing Merit Scribes and twenty-four thousand Minor Life Officers. May seven hundred thousand Jade Lads be entreated to descend, responding to the petition in full array. Let recovery be swift, restoring health and mobility.

With dragon’s ascent and tiger’s tread, may health and fortune abide, free from all else.

Respectfully, with utmost sincerity, this petition is humbly presented for review.

From the Great Mystery Capital, the Orthodox Unity, the Balanced Qi Lineage of the Celestial Master, the Yangping Abbey, the Three Caverns Disciple, the Perfected of Mount [X]—your servant [Name]—kneels and bows twice to submit this address:

In accordance with the documents, [Name], a Daoist official of such-and-such prefecture, county, township, and village, aged [number] years, along with [number] household members, male and female, hereby declares the following as stated.

The entire household, born of womb and bone, is blessed with descendants. Yet like ants in the grass, we remain mired in vulgar customs, unenlightened. Through the cycles of birth and death, we have attained this present form—raised in the wilds, unable to distinguish the six livestock. Misguided by false beliefs and inverted views, we have strayed for kalpas untold. Our past lives bear the weight of a thousand years’ fate, and only by fortunate encounter have we entered the realm of pure transformation. We have embraced the teachings of the Dharma, pledged ourselves to the Great Dao, and, though but sprouts in the field, have been counted among the people of Heaven, a cause for private joy.

Yet this flesh-bound servant has violated the hundred virtues in manifold ways. My transgressions are as scattered as a wolf’s tracks, so grave that the Three Officials weigh them heavily, bringing misfortune upon me. Of late, afflictions great and small, illnesses, calamities, demonic apparitions, and malevolent spirits have plagued my home, draining wealth and fortune, while inauspicious dreams haunt my nights. Moreover, my illness has grown severe, with sufferings too numerous to recount. Though family tends to me, no relief comes. I have prayed to the myriad spirits and made offerings, yet to no avail. Now, beset by hardship, I fear I may not survive. Pressed from above and below, I lack the resolve to rouse myself. I have consulted diviners far and wide, yet the tortoise-shell and milfoil reveal no favorable omen.

I confess that from the thirty-six generations of my great ancestors and forefathers, there have been offenses against the curses of Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, the stars and constellations, the Five Earth Gods, the curses of water and fire, and the transgressions of the Five Covenants and Seven Curses. The sins of my forebears have incurred the judgments of the Three Officials, bringing harm and depletion to the living. Thus, my life has been beset with hardship, and my affairs have been fraught with misfortune.

I fear that my seven generations of ancestors, during their lifetimes, defied Heaven and betrayed Earth, committing the five acts of rebellion and unfilial impiety, usurping rulers and seizing thrones, murdering sovereigns and lords. They may have wronged regional governors, high ministers, the Three Dukes, the Nine Chamberlains, the Directors of the Imperial Secretariat, the celestial ministers, or the starry hosts. Some may have deceived the gods and scorned their teachers, reviled and humiliated their parents. Others may have spurned sacred teachings, acting recklessly and self-servingly. They may have desecrated the pure abodes and tranquil sanctuaries of the gods, stolen others’ oxen, horses, livestock, or wealth, and when exposed, invoked the wrath of Heaven and Earth. They may have deceived the gods by calling upon the sun, pointed at the stars, or cursed one another beneath the altars of earth gods and ancestral temples, dying in wild places or through mutual retribution. The dead have drawn one another into endless cycles of suffering, leading to utter annihilation. Descendants have called out to one another in an unbroken chain, their torments in the underworld unceasing, extending calamity to later generations.

I further fear that my seven generations of ancestors, while serving in official posts, wrongfully killed the innocent and harmed the good and virtuous. They may have falsely accused and imprisoned worthy men, or seized others’ slaves, cattle, horses, and property, unjustly taking lives without reason. Some may have plotted against uncles and other kin, seizing their wealth, engaging in incestuous relations, or committing unspeakable acts. They may have murdered a man to take his wife, or schemed from both sides, sowing discord between two states. They knew not whose father they killed, whose son they harmed, whose husband they murdered, whose wife they took. They knew not whose state they plotted against, whose lord they harmed, whose ruler they slew, whose minister they betrayed. They knew not whose mother they killed, leaving whose child orphaned, whose goodness they deceived, whose worth they destroyed. They knew not whose possessions they stole, whose wealth they plundered, whose ancestors they felled, whose descendants they slaughtered. They knew not whose house they burned, whose lineage they extinguished. From generation to generation, the dead among my seven ancestors may have committed such sins, drawing the living into their retribution.

If any of my ancestors died by drowning, I pray they may be interred by water, their inner and outer selves cleansed and radiant. If any perished by fire, I pray they may be buried by fire, ascending as soaring immortals without hindrance. If any died by the sword, I pray they may be buried by the blade, their weapons sharp and auspicious for posterity. If any died in prison or the marketplace, I pray they may be buried there, their sufferings flowing away, ensuring no further misfortune for generations to come. If any were crushed by falling rocks, I pray they may be buried beneath them, their path unobstructed, with verdant grasses flourishing forever. If any were slain by tigers or wolves, I pray they may be buried by these beasts, their pelts and markings bringing boundless fortune through ten thousand kalpas. If any died by oppressive forces, I pray they may be buried thus, their rest undisturbed, their descendants forever secure. If any died of illness, choking, hanging, strangulation, or execution by the sword, may they each be interred according to their fate.

I further fear that those among my ancestors who met such deaths did so on inauspicious days, under ill-omened stars, their spirits condemned to the Three Officials and the Twenty-Four Hells. Some may have been forced by the living to labor in abandoned earth-god shrines, carrying sand and stones day and night to fill rivers and seas, never resting. The tormented dead have pleaded with the celestial bureaus, seeking to replace themselves with the living, thus bringing grave illness, peril, and misfortune upon me. All this stems from the inauspicious deaths of my ancestors, whose suffering harms the living, as they conspire with a hundred ghosts to deplete and afflict us. I fear that in their lifetimes, on the days they took wives, moved homes, or were buried, they violated taboos and prohibitions. Their deaths were ill-starred, their sins unexpiated.

Now I invoke the Eastern constellations—Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket—to extract and absolve the accumulated judgments and condemnations of my seven generations of ancestors and thirty-six generations of forebears, dissolving them entirely. May they ascend to the ranks of celestial beings, their clothing and sustenance naturally provided. If any remain in the Three Wretched Realms or the Eight Difficulties, may they each be delivered. If my seven generations of ancestors and forebears strayed from the Dao into heresy, their transgressions as vast as mountains, yet unabsolved, I pray that a hundred and twenty minor Perfected Officers and a host of celestial generals descend to harmonize and heal them. May they dispel all misfortune, expel malevolent ghosts, and drive away the specters of epidemics and wandering plagues, seizing and confining them all.

May the sins of my seven generations of ancestors—those of the five rebellions, the countless transgressions, the offenses against Heaven and Earth, the unforgivable crimes—all be pardoned and absolved, their judgments resolved. May my seven generations of ancestors and thirty-six generations of forebears who died by the sword, in bonds, by official execution, in prison or the marketplace, or were crushed by wood or stone, or perished from festering sores, drowning, burning, or were left unburied in distant lands, each be interred according to their fate. If in moving homes, marrying, building dwellings, or other undertakings, my seven generations of ancestors and thirty-six generations of forebears violated the baleful stars or the inauspicious lunar mansions, acted against reason, encountered adversity, or offended the Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Black Tortoise, or Hook Star, or the eight divine prohibitions, bringing misfortune, or if their burials or relocations transgressed the Great General of Disaster—may all such offenses be resolved.

May the Year Star and Great Yin, the clashes and baleful stars, be resolved. The Five Divisions’ piercing deceits and the Twelve Life-Mandating Deities; the monthly establishments, the Five Deficiencies and Six Expenditures; the celestial Year Star and the hidden dragon within the dwelling; the seven prison wardens and the spirits of wells and hearths; the Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Black Tortoise, Six Harmonies, and Hook Star; the abodes of the Heavenly Queen, Heavenly Void, Heavenly One, Merit Clerk, Messenger, Grand Unity, Ascending Brightness, Heavenly Rigidity, Follower, River Marshal, Great Auspice, and Lesser Auspice; the hundred hunting ghosts on the move, the destructive and slaying subordinate officials; the residual qi of mountains, rivers, temples, and shrines, the myriad malevolent ghosts and deities, the supplications and curses; the celestial prayers and terrestrial prayers, the great prayers and small prayers; the Three Examinations of the Southern Village, the Life-Mandating Great King; the deities of crossroads, the Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors; the Fuxi General, who styles himself among the Five Hegemons; the Slaying General, the Celestial Heart Governor; the Great Deity of the Nine Rivers, the Twelve Water Emperors; the Five Paths General and his left and right aides; all the prohibiting officials and the roving hunters of the Four Seas; the travelers on the roads, the Five Deficiencies and Six Expenditures; the Five Poisons and baleful winds, the Twelve Unyielding Ghosts; the qi of spring, autumn, winter, and summer, both pure and turbid; the years overlapping months, the days overlapping hours; may all ghosts, bandits, and entanglements that linger be distinguished and, in accordance with the times, dispersed and dissolved on all four sides, along with the curses.

From the Five Hegemons of the Yellow Emperor onward, the ghosts of ruined armies and slain generals who escaped the blade, the strange apparitions that gather and coalesce into malevolent spirits; the essences of cliffs, stones, grasses, and trees, of insects, rats, dragons, and snakes, of foxes, tigers, leopards, and crows, the myriad essences; the subordinate officials and residual qi of the Six Jia, Six Yi, Six Bing, Six Ding, Six Wu, Six Ji, Six Geng, Six Xin, Six Ren, and Six Gui, the ghosts of the Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches’ prohibitions in the twelve hours—may all such malevolent spirits, as they pursue one another, whether riding in chariots, on horseback, or on foot, be resolved. May the ghostly soldiers who bar the way and seize the souls of the living, harming the people of heaven, summoning the dead, and entangling the living through the unresolved oaths and curses of seven generations of parents and thirty-six generations of forebears, be dispersed.

From what place do the deceased seven generations of parents of this household come? What are their surnames and clans, and from which marriages do they derive? From which prefecture, county, village, and hamlet did they depart on the day of their death? What were the names of the officials who presided over their burials? To which stellar officials do they belong, and which constellations govern them?

The Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket—these Seven Stars of the Green Dragon govern them. Their position pertains to the East, to Jia and Yi, to the Green Emperor, the Year Star, and the essence of wood. They preside over the first, second, and third months of spring, the years, months, days, and hours of Yin, Mao, and Chen. At the onset of spring, when wood is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of earth.

The Dipper, Ox, Girl, Void, Danger, House, and Wall—these Seven Stars of the Black Tortoise govern them. Their position pertains to the North, to Ren and Gui, to the Black Emperor, the Chronographic Star, and the essence of water. They preside over the tenth, eleventh, and twelfth months of winter, the years, months, days, and hours of Hai, Zi, and Chou. At the onset of winter, when water is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of fire.

The Straddler, Harvester, Stomach, Net, Turtle, Hairy Head, and Triaster—these Seven Stars of the White Tiger govern them. Their position pertains to the West, to Geng and Xin, to the White Emperor, Venus, and the essence of metal. They preside over the seventh, eighth, and ninth months of autumn, the years, months, days, and hours of Shen, You, and Xu. At the onset of autumn, when metal is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of wood.

The Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wings, and Axletree—these Seven Stars of the Vermilion Bird govern them. Their position pertains to the South, to Bing and Ding, to the Red Emperor, Mars, and the essence of fire. They preside over the fourth, fifth, and sixth months of summer, the years, months, days, and hours of Si, Wu, and Wei. At the onset of summer, when fire is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of metal.

The Seven Stars of [missing text] govern the Center, pertaining to Wu and Ji, to the Hook Star, Saturn, and the essence of earth. They preside over the intercalary months, and when earth is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of water.

The twenty-eight lunar mansions and thirty-five stellar officials to which the deceased belong—may the celestial soldiers resolve their entanglements in accordance with the circumstances.

The Jade Armillary and Vermilion Palace, the seven stars of the Northern Dipper, together with the twenty-eight lodgings, encircle the heavens in 365¼ degrees. With ten thousand pure and eighty thousand turbid, the invoked lords and generals traverse and return, all to be liberated and transcended.

Let the malevolent stars be extinguished, and those bound for severance be cut off once more. Further dissolve the three yin and three yang, the thousand yielding and ten thousand norms, the thousand pure and ten thousand turbid, that they may no longer afflict the living.

For the thirty-six generations of ancestral fathers since the dawn of heaven and earth—those who passed before and those who died after—release the spirits of the deceased bound to the six jia and six yi, six bing and six ding, six wu and six ji, six geng and six xin, six ren and six gui, the gods of the Five Paths upon the twelve earthly branches. Let the baleful be extinguished, the auspicious set free, and all bonds severed. For those under the jurisdiction of the Five Punishments—five zi and five chou, five yin and five mao, five chen and five si, five wu and five wei, five shen and five you, five xu and five hai—the gods of the twelve earthly branches, let the malevolent spirits be extinguished and all ties cut off once more. Dissolve the bonds of the six jia cycles.

All great spirits of the Six Bowels and Six Yin, on behalf of this household, release the seven generations of parents and the thirty-six generations of ancestors, liberating all the deceased. If the departed has transgressed in the jiazi cycle with a thousand curses and ten thousand reproaches, a thousand calamities and ten thousand trials, a thousand sins and ten thousand faults, let the divine general Tianpeng, the yin official Lord Yin’a, and the Jade Maiden of the Great Mystery beseech their dissolution. If the departed has transgressed in the jiaxu cycle with a thousand sins and ten thousand faults, a thousand curses and ten thousand bonds, a thousand calamities and ten thousand trials, let the divine general Tiannei, the official Zhang Bulin, and his four hundred attendants, along with the Yellow-Silk Jade Maiden, dissolve them. If the departed has transgressed in the jiashen cycle with a thousand sins and ten thousand faults, let the divine general Tianchong, the official Cheng Zien, and the White-Silk Jade Maiden dissolve them. If the departed has transgressed in the jiawu cycle with a thousand sins and ten thousand faults, let the divine general Tianfu, the official Du Chujun, and the Han-Ying Jade Maiden dissolve them. If the departed has transgressed in the jiachen cycle with a thousand sins and ten thousand faults, let the divine general Tianqin, the official Duke Gongsun Tai, and the Prostrate-Essence Jade Maiden dissolve them. If the departed has transgressed in the jiayin cycle with a thousand sins and ten thousand faults, let the divine general Tianxin, the official Xu Junyao, and the Azure Essence Jade Maiden dissolve them.

In the first month, the Winnowing Basket Star belongs to the Heart Lodge. The three pure and three turbid of the five yin, governed by the Merit Officer, shall no longer afflict the living. In the second month, the Heart Star belongs to the Chamber Lodge. The three pure and three turbid of the five mao, governed by the Grand Impulse, shall no longer afflict the living. In the third month, the Clan Star belongs to the Horn Lodge. The three pure and five turbid of the five chen, governed by Heavenly Rigor, shall no longer afflict the living. In the fourth month, the Chariot Star belongs to the Wings Lodge. The three pure and one turbid of the five si, governed by the Great One, shall no longer afflict the living. In the fifth month, the Spread Star belongs to the Star Lodge. The four pure and five turbid of the five wu, governed by Victory First, shall no longer afflict the living. In the sixth month, the Willow Star belongs to the Well Lodge. The four pure and three turbid of the five wei, governed by Minor Auspice, shall no longer afflict the living. In the seventh month, the Three Stars belong to the Ghost Lodge. The two pure and three turbid of the five shen, governed by Transmission, shall no longer afflict the living. In the eighth month, the Net Lodge belongs to the Encouragement Star. The three pure and five turbid of the five you, governed by Following Chief, shall no longer afflict the living. In the ninth month, the Stomach Lodge belongs to the Straddling Star. The three pure and one turbid of the five xu, governed by River Chief, shall no longer afflict the living. In the tenth month, the Wall Lodge belongs to the House Star. The three pure and two turbid of the five hai, governed by Ascending Light, shall no longer afflict the living. In the eleventh month, the Danger Lodge belongs to the Dipper Star. The seven pure and nine turbid of the five zi, governed by Divine Assistant, shall no longer afflict the living. In the twelfth month, the Woman Star belongs to the Ox Lodge. The three pure and eight turbid of the five chou, governed by Great Auspice, shall no longer afflict the living. The five yielding and five firm, the three yin and five yang, shall no longer afflict the living.

Since the beginning of heaven and earth, the deceased have lived and died. The dead may have committed grievous sins in their past lives, unforgivable transgressions. Cast into the Nine Dark Hells of the Long Night, they suffer for all time—thirst quenched by icy water, hunger fed by iron pellets, fire and smoke forced down their throats. For a thousand kalpas and ten thousand eons, they cycle through the Five Paths, wandering in filth and ash, dragged through the Eight Difficulties, shamed in the Three Disciplines, forever bound to the realm of hungry ghosts, with no hope of escape. Unable to endure such torment, they reach out to the living, draining vitality, bringing a thousand misfortunes—illness in the household, great and small misfortunes, and all manner of afflictions. They claim the house is plagued by malevolent spirits and killing ghosts, that armies march and halt at will.

The Eastern Malevolent Spirit-King of Ghosts, surnamed Zhang, named Jiaozi. Nine feet and three inches tall, wielding a red staff and black rope, leading a hundred thousand green-clad soldiers. He specializes in inflicting twelve kinds of abdominal pain and green-faced illnesses. The afflicted suffer from eye pain, trembling in the head, neck, and body, constant chills and fever, heavy limbs, inability to eat, and vomiting when they do. His lesser ghost-king, named Zishi, strikes the family of the deceased, their punishment recorded in the Three Offices. The Hearth Lord, enraged, ascends daily to report their sins. The misfortunes of men and women, the twelve seductive worms, the ghosts of mountains, rivers, and earth altars—all unresolved. Drawn together, they come to afflict the living.

The Southern Malevolent Spirit-King of Ghosts, surnamed Zhu, named Long’an. Leading eighty thousand red-clad soldiers and ten thousand troops. He specializes in inflicting dysentery, sudden headaches, and acute illnesses—some dying in two or three days, others lingering for years. He causes people to vomit blood, their limbs wracked with pain, summoning the ghosts of the Three Mounds, earth altars, and wild places to afflict the living.

The Western Malevolent Spirit-King of Ghosts, surnamed Shi, named Guzi. Leading a hundred thousand white-clad soldiers and six hundred thousand officials and troops. He specializes in inflicting white dysentery, sudden death, deafness, and swelling—some dying in three, seven, or ten years.

The Northern Malevolent Spirit-King of Ghosts, surnamed Yang, named Jing.

The Northern Malevolent Spirit-King of Ghosts, surnamed Yang, named Jing, leads five hundred thousand black-clad soldiers, specializing in inflicting cholera and swelling diseases.

The Central Malevolent Spirit-King of Ghosts, surnamed Chen, named Rong, leads seven hundred thousand troops, specializing in inflicting water-borne diseases.

The Southeastern Malevolent Spirit-King of Ghosts, surname missing, named Da, leads nine hundred thousand troops, specializing in inflicting wind-borne diseases.

The Northwestern Malevolent Spirit-King of Ghosts, surnamed Lin, named Shizi, leads six hundred thousand troops, specializing in inflicting hernia.

The Three Heavens Ghost-King, surnamed Shi, named Long, leads seventy million, specializing in inflicting swelling diseases.

The Great Ghost-King of the Nine Heavens, surnamed Yan, leads ten thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting malignant qi and poisonous diseases that swiftly kill.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Shi, named Shou, leads seven hundred thousand troops, specializing in inflicting chills that kill.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Zhao, named Ju, leads thirty million troops, specializing in inflicting malaria.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Gongsun, named Yue, leads thirty-six thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting dampness-borne diseases.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Cao, named Wenzhi, leads ten thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting consumptive diseases.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Huo, named Xiong, leads seven hundred thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting thirst diseases.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Yuan, named Jing, leads three million six hundred thousand troops, specializing in inflicting shortness of breath.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Yi, named Mingzhi, leads seven hundred thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting cloud-borne diseases that seize infants, causing sudden death.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Ji, named Ziao, leads ten thousand ghosts, causing people to die at birth.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Guo, named Linzhi, leads thirty million ghosts, causing people to die by blades or in marketplaces.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Yang, named Mou, leads ten thousand ghosts, causing people to die in dark prisons.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Kong, named Shiming, leads seven hundred thousand ghosts, causing people to die in nightmares.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Ren, named Chang, leads thirty-eight thousand ghosts, causing people to die by self-strangulation.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Luo, named Qian, leads ten thousand ghosts, causing people to die from red diseases.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Yan, named Zhun, leads ten thousand ghosts, specializing in causing women to suffer from breech birth, killing both mother and child.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Lu, named Qiang, leads ten million ghosts, specializing in inflicting madness, driving people to drown themselves.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Lü, named Fuzhi, leads thirty-nine thousand ghosts, inflicting bewilderment that causes people to die from heart distress.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Huangfu, named Anzhi, leads ten thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting deafness and shortness of breath leading to death.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Ding, named Shiqi, leads ten thousand ghosts, seizing people’s fields and silkworms, causing crop failure.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Tan, named Daozhi, leads seven hundred thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting fire qi, burning houses and killing people.

Another Ghost-King, self-styled Headless Great General, leads ten thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting heart and abdominal diseases leading to death.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Fang, named Chebing, leads thirty million ghosts, specializing in inflicting yin omens.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Qiu, named Zhongzi, leads thirty thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting heat diseases.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Mu, named Xuanling, leads ten million ghosts, specializing in inflicting madness.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Wen, named Jinzhi, leads ten thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting throat diseases.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Ji, named Bingzhi, leads seven hundred thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting urinary blockage.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Gan, named Qi, leads six hundred thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting breech birth, killing infants at birth.

Such Ghost-Kings, along with the spirits of water and fire, the Five Dipper Generals, the Twelve Hour Spirits, the Five Marchmounts’ Mighty Warriors, and the Heavenly Soldiers—totaling two hundred sixty thousand—join with Sima Jizhu, the Cloud Master of Destiny, the Eldest Son of the Underworld, and eight hundred thousand others. Wherever their armies march or halt, they bring chaos to the people, causing endless calamities.

Summoning now the Demon-Heaven’s five million and fifty thousand warriors to descend, they are commanded to restrain these Ghost-Kings, forbidding them to rampage and recklessly slaughter the good and innocent. The Most High shall gather the last generations of the people, and each Ghost-King shall withdraw of its own accord. Should this petition be presented, for the master’s household—seven generations of ancestors and thirty-six generations of forebears—any lingering *qi* of the deceased that remains unresolved, any lingering misfortunes unfulfilled, or any who drag the living into their wake, each shall be curbed by the Green Maiden’s *Shaoshu* writ.

Another Ghost-King, overseer of the five directions, surnamed Hu, named Ling, leads thirty-nine thousand ghosts, causing people to bear no children, or their children to die at birth. If one’s active year falls in the *zi* branch, those who fall ill on the *zi* day are afflicted by the ghost named Xiang; on the *chou* day, by the ghost named Shiqui; on the *yin* day, by the ghost named Lan; on the *mao* day, by the ghost named Ahu; on the *chen* day, by the ghost named Wenzhi; on the *si* day, by the ghost named Ahuan; on the *wu* day, by the ghost named Shiqiang; on the *wei* day, by the ghost named Zhangnu; on the *shen* day, by the ghost named Xiaodu; on the *you* day, by the ghost named Anhou; on the *xu* day, by the ghost named Adu; on the *hai* day, by the ghost named Wenhou. The ghost of the day itself is named Changzi, leading thirty-six million.

The great Ghost-King belongs to the Grand Marshal Zhi Xun, who commands seventy million lesser Ghost-Kings. From this day forth, upon hearing the recitation of this petition, all shall be gathered and repelled.

The Ghost-King of the Nine Provinces, surnamed Ge, named Chuan, leads ten thousand ghosts, killing women. The Qiang Ghost-King, surnamed Hu, named Baifang, leads one ghost, killing people by choking on parrot tongues. The Rong Ghost-King, surnamed [missing], named Cheng, leads thirty thousand ghosts, inflicting *baixia* disease. The Hu-Lu Ghost-King, surnamed Wu, named Xiao, leads ten thousand ghosts, inflicting bewilderment. The Man-Liao Ghost-King, surnamed Lan, named Zhong, leads ten thousand ghosts, inflicting mouth pain. The Mountain Ghost-King, surnamed Qiu, named Wenqing, leads ten thousand ghosts, inflicting chest pain. The Ghost-King of the Ten Directions, surnamed Zhou, named Ju, leads thirty million ghosts, inflicting weak legs. The Water Spirit Ghost-King, surnamed Meng, named Ben, leads ten thousand ghosts, inflicting blindness. The Ghost-King of the Five Marchmounts, surnamed Yang, named Guanglong, leads seven hundred thousand ghosts, inflicting gluttony and causing sleep sickness.

All such Ghost-Kings, leading their ghosts to roam among people, lie in wait for human decline to plot harm against the living. Today, upon the presentation of this petition, let the spirits of mountains, rivers, forests, and marshes, the village shrines of the world, and all perverse ghosts and malevolent deities be scattered and routed, collapsing like sand or shattering like tiles, dissolving in accordance with this writ. Let the master’s household recover from illness, and let the ten thousand spirits come to their aid. Should any of the master’s kin or in-laws be imprisoned or exiled, let them all be released.

The Eastern Directing Talisman’s great ghost is named Qingcao, leading seventy million ghosts, specializing in inflicting lower back pain. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Qiang, named Dang, leads twenty-eight million ghosts, specializing in inflicting qi depletion, incessant bloody flux, and dribbling urine. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Yuan, named Wenxuan, leads seventy million ghosts, specializing in inflicting soul-loss death, rendering the afflicted beyond aid. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Xu, named Jing, leads seventy-eight thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting loss of spirit. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Le, named Yu, leads six hundred thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting tumors and swellings. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Rong, named Qi, leads eleven thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting heart confusion. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Cui, named Shishan, leads thirty thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting genital swelling and bloody flux. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Ma, named Xiang, leads thirty-seven thousand ghosts, specializing in inciting people to kill parents, teachers, and disciples, to burn people’s grain, wheat, houses, and altars, and to afflict people with incurable diseases, entering their hearts to drive them to such acts.

Another Ghost-King, surnamed Wu, named Ban, leads three thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting red and yellow bloody flux. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Ming, named Changsheng, leads twelve thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting mutual hatred between husband and wife. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Xie, named Langzhi, leads six hundred thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting mutual aversion between men and women. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Xie, named Mingzhi, leads fifty thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting cleft-lip children. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Lan, named Jinzhi, leads seventy thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting rebellious children and frequent internal strife. Another Ghost-King, surnamed Tang, named Lu, leads thirty thousand ghosts, specializing in inflicting malign *qi* disease.

Such Ghost-Kings, along with the Five Directions’ *zhu* ghosts—eastern blue *zhu*, southern red *zhu*, western white *zhu*, northern black *zhu*, and central yellow *zhu*—the *zhu* of those who die at dawn, the *zhu* of those who die at dusk; the *zhu* of one *li*, two *li*, three *li*, four *li*, five *li*, ten *li*, twenty *li*, thirty *li*, forty *li*, fifty *li*, a hundred *li*, two hundred *li*, three hundred *li*, four hundred *li*, five hundred *li*, six hundred *li*, seven hundred *li*, eight hundred *li*, nine hundred *li*, a thousand *li*, ten thousand *li*; the *zhu* of men, the *zhu* of women, the *zhu* of servants and maids, near *zhu* and far *zhu*; blue *zhu*, white *zhu*, red *zhu*, black *zhu*, yellow *zhu*, the Five *Zhu* Generals; great *zhu* and small *zhu*, high *zhu* and low *zhu*; the *zhu* of the six livestock, the *zhu* of birds and beasts, the *zhu* of grasses and trees.

The *zhu* of the sun and moon, the *zhu* of the stars and constellations. The *zhu* of the Rong and Qiang, the *zhu* of the Hu and barbarian captives. The *zhu* of Wu and Shu, the *zhu* of the Yi and Di, the *zhu* of the Man and Liao. The *zhu* of thirty-seven thousand, the *zhu* of omens and portents, the *zhu* of gates and households. The *zhu* of the sun’s wandering, the *zhu* of the moon’s passage. The *zhu* of the Great General, the *zhu* of Tai Sui, the *zhu* of Tai Yin. The *zhu* of the Five Phases, the *zhu* of the four seasons’ transitions. The *zhu* of funeral carts and the Dipper’s conjunction, the *zhu* of death’s sequence. The *zhu* of the year’s fate, one’s original destiny, the three punishments, and the red affliction; the *zhu* of male and female. The *zhu* of names that seize one another, the *zhu* of eyes and colors that correspond, the *zhu* of surnames that mutually claim one another.

When *zhu* comes from the east, sever it with metal. When *zhu* comes from the south, extinguish it with water. When *zhu* comes from the north, repel it with earth. When *zhu* comes from the west, dissolve it with fire. When *zhu* comes from the center, exorcise it with wood. The *zhu* of the Five Phases, each in its proper position, will naturally cease and vanish.

If there is an ominous black qi in the east, I humbly invoke the Nine Billion and Nine Million Soldiers of the Azure Emperor Lord, leading seventy myriad azure troops, to exorcise and dissolve it. When *zhu* comes from the south, I humbly invoke the Eight Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Vermilion Emperor Lord, leading seventy myriad vermilion troops, to dissolve and repel it. When *zhu* comes from the west, I humbly invoke the Six Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the White Emperor Lord, leading ninety myriad and ten thousand white troops, to dissolve and repel it. When *zhu* comes from the north, I humbly invoke the Five Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Black Emperor Great General, leading seventy myriad black troops, to come and exorcise and repel it. When *zhu* comes from the center, I humbly invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Yellow Emperor Lord, leading seventy myriad yellow troops, to descend and sever it.

Should the pestilential afflictions of the five directions, the Yellow Slave Brothers seventy-two in number, and the plague-bearing ghosts ride the wind and mount the sparrows, entering the homes of men to await their moments of weakness and seize their young, may all be gathered, severed, and banished ten thousand *li* away. Moreover, the *zhu* ghosts of the five directions, styling themselves Meng Tian, Chi Jing, Ji Liang, and Wang Zu, each leading a thousand men, enter homes to seize the young, bringing malarial fevers. Also, the malevolent ghosts of the five directions, calling themselves Wu Emperor, Han King, Wu Zixu, Duke of Zhou, and Great Ministers, specialize in causing abdominal distension. Further, *zhu* ghosts styling themselves ancient great kings and lords of the world’s great generals come to sicken and deceive men, falsely claiming kinship as elders, slaying the young, and filling homes with misfortune, illness, and calamity.

There is also a ghost king surnamed Yan, named Gaozi, who leads thirty thousand men to spread madness and wailing sickness. The *zhu* ghosts of the Five Emperors of the five directions, calling themselves Zhang Yuanbo, lead ten thousand ghosts to spread chills, fevers, and perverse malarial afflictions. The *zhu* ghosts of the five directions, styling themselves Jiao Dan and the Innocent Yang, lead three thousand ghosts to slay children. Another of the five directions’ killing ghosts, calling himself Liu Yuanda, leads seven hundred myriad ghosts to perpetrate seventy kinds of epidemics. Another ghost king, calling himself Zhong Shiji, leads six hundred myriad ghosts to cause five kinds of dysentery. Another ghost king, calling himself Zhao Gongming, leads thirty thousand ghosts to cause axe wounds in homes. Another ghost king, calling himself Shi Wenye, leads seventy-two myriad ghosts to cause death by swelling and qi. Another ghost king, surnamed Du and named Zhou, leads seventy myriad ghosts to preside over prison deaths. Another ghost king, surnamed Zong and named Wenhou, leads three thousand six hundred ghosts to cause fires. Another ghost king, calling himself Wu Wang Ghost, leads ten million ghosts to cause drowning deaths. Another ghost king, calling himself Tian Dao, leads seventy myriad ghosts to cause death by longing. Another ghost king, calling himself Wang Qian, Bai Qi, and Deng Ai’s ghosts, leads thirty thousand ghosts to spread myriad illnesses and kill men.

There is yet another ghost king, claiming to be the Great Spirit of the August Emperor, who enters homes to drive out household ghosts, demanding blood sacrifices, along with the ghosts of omens and portents, hunting and communal sacrifices, and the spirits of those who come seeking. I further invoke the Qiungqi, devourers of ghosts, seven hundred myriad in number, to descend together in succession and consume them, allowing none to escape.

Moreover, I, [Name], of high and low station in this household, declare: in this life’s encounter, I have been numbered among the Dao’s followers, yet I have failed to respond with devotion to the Dao, and my offenses have not been sufficiently prolonged. My household is not harmonious. Now, afflicted by illness and distress, I fear I cannot escape. I have heard that the great Dao succors all things; none who surrender themselves to it fail to receive its grace. Yet my original master is distant, and my pleas cannot reach him. Seeing that I share the same dharma as you, I hasten to welcome you to my home, beseeching a written petition to save and cure myself.

To you, who hold office and bear the beauty of the dharma’s qi, I declare my inability to fully proclaim the dharma’s power as I witness the calamities and distress of this household. With trepidation, I prostrate myself and humbly submit this petition, one document addressed to the Heavenly Courts, along with offerings to the Five Emperors. I beg the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Master, the Lineage Masters, the Three Masters, the Lady of the Gate, the Twenty-Four Worthies, the Twelve Perfected Saints, the Compassionate Father and Holy Mother, and the Lords of Qi, to bestow the Dao’s qi upon this household, to cover and clothe us in its grace.

I respectfully follow the Celestial Master’s *One Thousand Two Hundred Officials’ Petition Text* to invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Five Canopies Great Generals of the Void, along with two thousand officials and generals. I further invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Five Divisions’ Great Generals, and the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Vigorous and Stalwart Great Generals, along with one thousand two hundred officials and generals.

I further invoke the Seven Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Central Palace of the Vermilion Heaven, the Great Army of the Southern Encampment, the Vermilion Soldiers of Bingzi, and the Valiant and Stalwart Officers and Soldiers. May they descend to this household to seize and eradicate any malevolent qi or possessing spirits from the Five Directions, severing their roots and lineages.

I also invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Lord of Balanced Qi, along with one thousand two hundred officials and generals, together with the Six Hundred Million Officers of Qi-Seizing and Qi-Consuming, Ghost-Seizing and Ghost-Consuming, Evil-Seizing and Evil-Consuming, Ominous-Seizing and Ominous-Consuming, and Sickness-Seizing and Sickness-Consuming, all to descend as one and arrive above this household to seize and consume them. Should there be any malevolent demons or evil ghosts, may they be utterly swept away and annihilated.

I further invoke the Nine Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Eastern Garrison Great General to encamp at the eastern gate of this household. I invoke the Eight Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Southern Garrison Great General to encamp at the southern gate. I invoke the Six Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Western Garrison Great General to encamp at the western gate. I invoke the Five Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Northern Garrison Great General to encamp at the northern gate. I invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Central Garrison Great General to encamp in the central courtyard.

I also invoke the Seventy Million Myriad Hosts of the Ghost-Consuming Officers of Qiongqi to descend as one and consume the Five Crones and Fengqi Ghosts within this household. Should there be the Five Contract Generals—the Front Hunting General, Rear Hunting General, Left Hunting General, Right Hunting General—along with Fengqi Lady, the Five Contract Parents, Male and Female Contracts, Child and Grandchild Contracts, and the Five Thousand Six Hundred Contract Officials, all conspiring to assemble and plot harm against the master and household, may they all be driven out and banished ten thousand leagues away, shattered like crumbling sand and collapsing tiles.

I earnestly invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Immortal Officials and Generals, along with one thousand two hundred officials and generals, to seize and repel all ghosts in the world who claim the titles of the Five Wilds and Six Poisons, and the One Hundred Twenty Ominous Howling Spirits, sweeping them from this dwelling and utterly annihilating them.

I further invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the True Heaven Great General, along with one thousand two hundred officials and generals, to descend upon this household and seize and expel all ghosts falsely claiming ominous titles, banishing them ten thousand leagues away.

I also invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Lord of the White Chariot and White Horse in the Most High Palace, along with one thousand two hundred officials, and the Seven Hundred Twenty Thousand Encamped Troops, to seize and slay all malevolent and murderous ghosts from the Four Directions.

I further invoke the Seventy Million Soldiers of the Nine Provinces’ Inspectors and the Son of Heaven’s Supervisors, each to encamp within the gates of this household, to seize and slay all malevolent possessing spirits from the Five Directions that initiate harm, utterly eradicating them.

I also invoke the Eight Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Lord of Heaven-Shaking Earth-Quaking in the Supreme Heaven’s Qian Palace to descend as one and arrive above this household, to seize and slay all encamped ghosts and the malevolent qi of the Five Directions’ possessing spirits, utterly repelling them.

I further invoke the Seven Hundred Eighty Thousand Soldiers of the Great Drum of Lofty Demons and the Red Yang Troops of the Five Hu Generals to descend as one and arrive within this household, to seize and eradicate all encamped calamity-possessing ghosts, the hundred evil ghosts and bandits, and the ghosts of monsters and specters, utterly slaying them.

I also invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Ghost-Slaying Great General, along with one thousand two hundred officials and generals, to descend as one and arrive above this household, to seize, slay, and disperse all ghosts causing illness, utterly shattering and banishing them.

I further invoke the Seven Hundred Thousand Soldiers of the Iron-Faced Ghost-Consuming Cavalry, the Winged Serpent and White Tiger Cavalry, and the Driving-Out Great General to descend as one and arrive above this household, to seize the Five Ailment-Encamped Ghosts, the myriad evil and deceased spirits haunting this dwelling, and all banished ghosts, utterly crushing and annihilating them.

I also invoke the One Hundred Twenty Thousand Soldiers of the Lofty Heaven’s Ten-Thousand-Fathom Great Ghost and the King of a Hundred Ghosts, along with seven hundred thousand officials and generals, to descend as one and arrive above this household, to seize and repel all encamped ghosts, the Yellow Slave and Pestilence Ghost Bandits, utterly seizing and banishing them.

I further invoke the Two Thousand Two Hundred Lords of Life-Prolonging and Calamity-Averting, and the Two Thousand Two Hundred Lords of Substitution and Replacement, to descend as one and arrive above this household, to substitute and prolong the life of the afflicted, averting calamity. May the perils of the Five Directions all be transcended, extending years and increasing longevity, passing through disasters and averting calamities, preserving life without end.

I also invoke the Fifteen Attendants of Healing Merit, the Celestial Physicians and Grand Physicians, the Officers of Medicine, Master Lu, Bian Que, the Jade Maidens, each one thousand two hundred in number, to descend as one, bearing efficacious prescriptions, divine decoctions, sacred pills, and the tools of acupuncture and moxibustion, entering the body of the afflicted to circulate life and distribute qi. Where needles are fitting, let needles be applied; where moxibustion is fitting, let moxibustion be given; where decoctions are fitting, let decoctions be administered; where pills are fitting, let pills be bestowed. According to the location of the illness, may they devote themselves to healing and protection, ensuring complete recovery. May the Five Viscera be harmonized, the Hundred Vessels flow freely, the hun-soul be settled, the po-soul be stabilized, and the myriad spirits stand guard.

Should there be deafness or blindness, I invoke the Twelve Lords of Bright Vision, along with one hundred twenty officials and generals, to descend as one and attend to the healing of deafness and blindness, restoring clarity and brightness, sharp hearing and keen sight.

The deceased, bitter and distressed, unable to extricate themselves, lodge complaints in the celestial courts, dragging the living into their suits.

Should any act with violence, we beseech that, following the submission of this oral memorial, the afflicted swiftly recover, the household remain free of misfortune, wealth and treasure flow in, blessings and prosperity daily increase, all wishes be fulfilled, and every direction yield compliance.

For all the lords, generals, officers, and soldiers who have rendered service in capturing and aiding, we shall, on the three auspicious days of the triennial assembly, submit a comprehensive memorial detailing their merits and recommending promotions, sparing no effort to honor our vows.

With gratitude, we implore the Most High to discern and heed our plea. Your humble servant, in reverence, respectfully entrusts this to the Inner and Outer Officials, the Direct Envoys of the Orthodox Unity, the Merit Registrars, the Left and Right Envoys, the Yin-Yang Decree Officers, the Chariot of Scarlet Talisman Officers, the Officers of the Rushing Wind Couriers, and the Memorial-Mounted Steeds Officers—one hundred twenty each—to carry out the task.

We submit this urgent oral memorial, one copy, to the Three Celestial Courts of the Most High, awaiting your decree. Your servant, with trepidation and awe, bows his head to the ground, prostrates himself, and respectfully submits this for your attention. Your servant, of such-and-such surname, from such-and-such prefecture and county.

In accordance with the rites of the Grand Clarity,

On the day and hour of such-and-such month in the year of the Great Year [Tai Sui], at the altar of so-and-so,

Your servants, so-and-so and others, respectfully submit this solemn memorial:

To the Most High Lord of the Great Dao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Masters, the Female Masters, the Lineage Masters, the Succession Masters, and the Lady of the Three Masters.

Let the Merit Officers and Messengers distinguish the urgent from the routine, ascend without delay, and take care not to linger.

Your servants prostrate themselves upon the earth, awaiting your decree. We shall hold our breath as if for three meals.

The submission of this oral memorial is now concluded. Next, we present it to the officials.

All shall pass through the Gates of Myriad Wonders, reentering in proper sequence. The Directing Messenger and Chief Attendant shall take their places: those on the left return to the left, those on the right to the right. Descending, they enter the Cinnabar Field; ascending, they rise to the Mud-Pill Palace, adhering fast within your servants’ bodies. The five viscera and six bowels, the Seven Governors and Nine Palaces, the Twelve Chambers, the Four Seasons and Five Phases, the hundred-and-eighty joints and mechanisms—all shall resume their hidden offices, arrayed in their proper positions, without confusion or disorder.

The Generals and attendant hosts previously summoned shall each return to your servants’ bodies, entering the Golden Hall and Jade Chamber. When your servants later issue the call, they shall emerge again, performing their duties as before.

Next, the Incense Officers and Messengers are summoned to invoke the Dragon and Tiger Lords at your servants’ left and right, and to urgently call forth the Messengers of the Five Directions. Your servants’ oral memorial is now concluded.

May the stillness of this chamber spontaneously generate golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushroom blossoms before this incense flame. May your servants attain the true qi of the Dao, thereby achieving long life and transcending mortality. May all people ascend as immortals. **The Supreme Cavernous Divine and Abyssal Divine Incantations for Healing Illnesses – Oral Petition Chapter**

Sound the celestial drum thrice to open the incense burner.

Supreme Mysterious Origin, Five Numinous Venerable Lord, Three *Qi* Orthodox Deities—hasten to summon within us, your servants: the True Officials of the Five Corporeal Forms, the Three-and-Five Merit Officers, the Upper and Lower Grand Masters, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Incense-Bearing Envoys, the Message-Transmitting Celestial Maidens, and the Document-Holding Lads—twenty-four each.

The Ministers and Vice Ministers, the Messengers and Lesser Clerks—one hundred twenty thousand.

We hereby report to the Supreme Three Heavens’ Mysterious Origin Great Dao Lord and the Ten Directions’ Supreme Ones.

As we now enter the oratory and burn incense to present this oral petition, we pray for healing and disaster dispelling, that the Eight Directions’ Orthodox *Qi* may enter our bodies, allowing our supplications to ascend directly before the Jade Emperor’s throne.

Next, bow to the four directions, beginning in the west and ending in the east, sounding the celestial drum thirty-six times.

Then, kneel to dispatch the officers and soldiers:

From within us, your servants, we reverently send forth:
- The Transcendent Numinous High Officials and Direct Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand each.
- The Orthodox Unity Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Three-in-One Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The *Qi*-Hastening Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Illness-Healing Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Lesser Physician Clerks—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Upper, Middle, and Lower Section Merit Officers—one hundred twenty thousand each.
- The Upper, Middle, and Lower Section Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand each.
- The High Chariot Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Crimson Chariot Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Primordial True Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Primordial Spirit Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Yang Spirit Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The Yin Spirit Envoys—one hundred twenty thousand.
- The High Chariot Governors—two hundred forty thousand.
- The *Qi*-Seizing and *Qi*-Consuming Clerks, Ghost-Seizing and Ghost-Consuming Clerks, Malevolence-Seizing and Malevolence-Consuming Clerks, Calamity-Seizing and Calamity-Consuming Clerks, Essence-Seizing and Essence-Consuming Clerks, Misfortune-Seizing and Misfortune-Consuming Clerks, Illness-Seizing and Illness-Consuming Clerks—six hundred thousand each.
- The Supreme Healing Jade Maidens and the Ten Directions’ Overseers—seven hundred thousand each.

Let all who emerge don their solemn attire, crowns and pendants, and arrange their majestic regalia. Let them array their processional insignia, rank upon rank, standing in solemn formation.

Before, behind, left, and right of us, your servants, let each wield blades outward, ordering weapons and staves. Let a thousand voices chant in unison, ten thousand in harmony.

Three paces from us, let them regard one another, awaiting the Direct Merit Officers—each wearing a Heaven-Reaching Crown, clad in black single robes, girded with Dragon-Tiger Talismans, and wielding Vajra Halberds—seven hundred twenty thousand.

Before us, the Orthodox Unity Merit Officers—each wearing a Vermilion Yang Headband, clad in crimson ceremonial robes, girded with Heaven-Reaching Spears, and wielding Luminous Swords—seven hundred eighty thousand.

Behind us, the Soaring Heaven Great Generals—each wearing a Five-Colored Crown, clad in brocade armor, girded with Hundred-Forged Blades, and wielding Nine-Bend Blades—four hundred thousand.

To our left, the Fierce Horizontal Great Generals—each wearing a Dark Yin Crimson Headband, clad in Seven-Jade Black Robes, and girded with Hundred-Forged Black Halberds—nine hundred thousand.

To our right, the Merit Officers above, the Registrars below, the Heavenly Officials to the left, the Earthly Officials to the right, the Civil Officials before, and the Martial Officials behind.

The Five-Colored Banners flutter in majestic order. They ride chariots and mount steeds, dragon and tiger cavalry. Those on foot and in palanquins proceed in ranks.

The Azure Hosts in the east, the White Hosts in the west, the Crimson Hosts in the south, the Black Hosts in the north, and the Yellow Hosts at the center.

The shield-bearers advance, the archers follow. The Bandit Officers to the left, the Guardians to the right. Drums and bells resound, horns echo—deep and thunderous.

The Five Marchmounts’ armies patrol the streets. The Four Seas’ armies blockade the nine provinces. The armies of Kunlun’s Jade Capital overflow. The voids within and without respond in unison.

Command the various Ghost Kings to order the demonic soldiers, each to slay the ghosts.

Now, from [so-and-so] prefecture, county, village, and household, [so-and-so] man or woman petitions:

Descendants of ancient officials, common folk by custom, we have, through a thousand years’ fate, entered the Daoist gate. As latter-day followers, we submit to the Great Dao, privately rejoicing in its grace.

Yet, through unclear devotion, we have incurred *qi*-afflictions and attracted misfortune. Of late, our households suffer ill fortune, our dwellings harbor calamities—ten thousand miseries, countless disasters.

Moreover, [so-and-so] has, for [so many] months and days, suddenly fallen ill, with symptoms [as described], fearing survival is unlikely.

We have heard that the Dao can reverse death and restore life. Those who surrender to it are never left unaided. Petitions that reach the throne are never unanswered. The grace lies with the Supreme Ones; the matter rests with the Overseers.

We, your foolish servants, uphold the Three Caverns’ decrees, unable to bear the urgency of the suffering before us. Great and small, high and low—we kowtow, beat our cheeks, and plead in earnest, seeking deliverance.

Unable to endure the sight of this mortal’s desperate plight, like a candle in the wind, we prostrate ourselves, presenting this oral petition once, laid upon the jade table before us.

As the petitioner’s words are recorded, we humbly submit each matter. We dare not transgress the rites, though much remains to be said.

Misguided by false beliefs and inverted views, we have strayed for kalpas untold. Our past lives bear the weight of a thousand years’ fate, and only by fortunate encounter have we entered the realm of pure transformation. We have embraced the teachings of the Dharma, pledged ourselves to the Great Dao, and, though but sprouts in the field, have been counted among the people of Heaven, a cause for private joy.

Yet this flesh-bound servant has violated the hundred virtues in manifold ways. My transgressions are as scattered as a wolf’s tracks, so grave that the Three Officials weigh them heavily, bringing misfortune upon me. Of late, afflictions great and small, illnesses, calamities, demonic apparitions, and malevolent spirits have plagued my home, draining wealth and fortune, while inauspicious dreams haunt my nights. Moreover, my illness has grown severe, with sufferings too numerous to recount. Though family tends to me, no relief comes. I have prayed to the myriad spirits and made offerings, yet to no avail. Now, beset by hardship, I fear I may not survive. Pressed from above and below, I lack the resolve to rouse myself. I have consulted diviners far and wide, yet the tortoise-shell and milfoil reveal no favorable omen.

chunks.original_text: 唯言某家亲大祖父三十六世以来，有犯天诅地诅、日月之诅、星辰之诅、五社之诅、水火之诅、五盟七诅之罪。 先世所犯，谴在三官，来耗害生人。 致令居生轗轲，事云云。 皆恐某家七世父祖，昔日生在之时，违天负地，五逆不孝，诛君截位，杀害帝主。 方伯二千石，令长大臣，三公九卿，尚书仆射，星宿大臣。 或欺神慢师，骂辱父母。 或嫌度圣闻，妄造自用。 或坏真宫静治神人鬼屋，偷人牛马牲口财帛，人所发觉，引天及地。 欺神唤日，指点星辰。 社祠庙下，更相咒诅，野道复连而死。 死者相引，历劫不休，遂至弥灭。 子孙相呼，展转不绝，地下不断，殃及后世。 又恐某家先世七祖父母，依官仕宦，枉杀无辜，杀害良善。 讼系贤人璧他奴婢牛马之属，枉绝人命，不以道理。 或谋伯叔中外之亲，取其钱财，淫色内乱，非人所知。 或杀人之夫，图人之妻。 细作两头，交乱二国。 不知杀谁之父，害谁之子。 不知杀谁之夫，害谁之妇。 不知图谁之国，害谁之主。 不知杀谁之君，不知害谁之臣。 不知杀何人之母，孤何人之子。 不知欺谁之善，杀谁之贤。 不知偷何人之物，不知盗何人之财。 不知伐何人之祖，不知杀何人之孙。 木知烧何人之屋，灭谁之门。 先世以来，亡人七祖，有如此罪，引逮及先亡者。 某家先世，或有落水死者，即请水葬之，清凉内外朗然。 若以火烧死者，即请火葬之，赫赫飞仙无碍。 若刀兵而死者，即请刀兵而葬之，刀兵滑利，利於后世。 若狱市死者，即请狱市葬之，狱市长流，世世无他。 若落崟石而死者，请以崟石葬之，崟石道畅，万草青青。 若虎狼害死者，即请以虎狼葬之，虎狼毛皮文章，使万劫通利。 若卧厌死者，即请卧厌葬之，清净绵绵，世世安吉。 若有病死者，哽死、缢死、绞死、刀兵斩死者，各随所属，安而葬之。 又恐上世亡人等，有如此死者，死日不吉，星宿不度，亡者谪作，在三官二十四地狱之中。 或世人社庙道废，昼夜担沙负石，填江塞海，不得休息。 亡人愁毒，讼诉天曹主者，求取生人自代，致令某疾病危厄、灾殃患祸。 皆是先世亡人死日不吉，不利生人，与百鬼梯道来往，耗害生人。 恐亡人生存之日，取妇移徙之日，葬埋之时，犯触禁忌。 亡人死日不吉，星宿不灭。 今请东方角亢氏房心尾箕，拔出某家亡人七世父母三十六世以来殃考基谪，悉令除判，消然解脱。 上生天人之中，衣食自然。 若在三涂八难之中者，一一为迁拔之。 若亡人等七世父母先世以来，叛道入邪，反覆之愆，罪结山岳，未蒙原赦者，愿请太真小吏百二十人，官将一合来下，和愈之。 解否无他摄鬼等，合共驱逐小鬼，时行疫疠脱籍之鬼，一切收而郁之。 若先亡后死七祖父母，五逆之殃，无状之罪，万过千咎，违天负地，难恕之愆，一切原赦，除判了了。 令某家七祖父母三十六世以来，刀兵木索、县官牢狱市死者，或木石所槌磔死者，或痍肿恶疮死者，或落水火沉烧死者，或有流离他方不得葬埋之者，各各随其死处而葬之。 若某家七祖父母三十六世以来，移徙嫁娶，造宅所为，犯触恶星丑宿，不得道理，逢逆劫杀，青龙、白虎、朱雀、玄武、勾陈，八神禁忌，以致不祥。 或移徙葬埋，犯解大将军。

I confess that from the thirty-six generations of my great ancestors and forefathers, there have been offenses against the curses of Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, the stars and constellations, the Five Earth Gods, the curses of water and fire, and the transgressions of the Five Covenants and Seven Curses. The sins of my forebears have incurred the judgments of the Three Officials, bringing harm and depletion to the living. Thus, my life has been beset with hardship, and my affairs have been fraught with misfortune.

I fear that my seven generations of ancestors, during their lifetimes, defied Heaven and betrayed Earth, committing the five acts of rebellion and unfilial impiety, usurping rulers and seizing thrones, murdering sovereigns and lords. They may have wronged regional governors, high ministers, the Three Dukes, the Nine Chamberlains, the Directors of the Imperial Secretariat, the celestial ministers, or the starry hosts. Some may have deceived the gods and scorned their teachers, reviled and humiliated their parents. Others may have spurned sacred teachings, acting recklessly and self-servingly. They may have desecrated the pure abodes and tranquil sanctuaries of the gods, stolen others’ oxen, horses, livestock, or wealth, and when exposed, invoked the wrath of Heaven and Earth. They may have deceived the gods by calling upon the sun, pointed at the stars, or cursed one another beneath the altars of earth gods and ancestral temples, dying in wild places or through mutual retribution. The dead have drawn one another into endless cycles of suffering, leading to utter annihilation. Descendants have called out to one another in an unbroken chain, their torments in the underworld unceasing, extending calamity to later generations.

I further fear that my seven generations of ancestors, while serving in official posts, wrongfully killed the innocent and harmed the good and virtuous. They may have falsely accused and imprisoned worthy men, or seized others’ slaves, cattle, horses, and property, unjustly taking lives without reason. Some may have plotted against uncles and other kin, seizing their wealth, engaging in incestuous relations, or committing unspeakable acts. They may have murdered a man to take his wife, or schemed from both sides, sowing discord between two states. They knew not whose father they killed, whose son they harmed, whose husband they murdered, whose wife they took. They knew not whose state they plotted against, whose lord they harmed, whose ruler they slew, whose minister they betrayed. They knew not whose mother they killed, leaving whose child orphaned, whose goodness they deceived, whose worth they destroyed. They knew not whose possessions they stole, whose wealth they plundered, whose ancestors they felled, whose descendants they slaughtered. They knew not whose house they burned, whose lineage they extinguished. From generation to generation, the dead among my seven ancestors may have committed such sins, drawing the living into their retribution.

If any of my ancestors died by drowning, I pray they may be interred by water, their inner and outer selves cleansed and radiant. If any perished by fire, I pray they may be buried by fire, ascending as soaring immortals without hindrance. If any died by the sword, I pray they may be buried by the blade, their weapons sharp and auspicious for posterity. If any died in prison or the marketplace, I pray they may be buried there, their sufferings flowing away, ensuring no further misfortune for generations to come. If any were crushed by falling rocks, I pray they may be buried beneath them, their path unobstructed, with verdant grasses flourishing forever. If any were slain by tigers or wolves, I pray they may be buried by these beasts, their pelts and markings bringing boundless fortune through ten thousand kalpas. If any died by oppressive forces, I pray they may be buried thus, their rest undisturbed, their descendants forever secure. If any died of illness, choking, hanging, strangulation, or execution by the sword, may they each be interred according to their fate.

I further fear that those among my ancestors who met such deaths did so on inauspicious days, under ill-omened stars, their spirits condemned to the Three Officials and the Twenty-Four Hells. Some may have been forced by the living to labor in abandoned earth-god shrines, carrying sand and stones day and night to fill rivers and seas, never resting. The tormented dead have pleaded with the celestial bureaus, seeking to replace themselves with the living, thus bringing grave illness, peril, and misfortune upon me. All this stems from the inauspicious deaths of my ancestors, whose suffering harms the living, as they conspire with a hundred ghosts to deplete and afflict us. I fear that in their lifetimes, on the days they took wives, moved homes, or were buried, they violated taboos and prohibitions. Their deaths were ill-starred, their sins unexpiated.

Now I invoke the Eastern constellations—Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket—to extract and absolve the accumulated judgments and condemnations of my seven generations of ancestors and thirty-six generations of forebears, dissolving them entirely. May they ascend to the ranks of celestial beings, their clothing and sustenance naturally provided. If any remain in the Three Wretched Realms or the Eight Difficulties, may they each be delivered. If my seven generations of ancestors and forebears strayed from the Dao into heresy, their transgressions as vast as mountains, yet unabsolved, I pray that a hundred and twenty minor Perfected Officers and a host of celestial generals descend to harmonize and heal them. May they dispel all misfortune, expel malevolent ghosts, and drive away the specters of epidemics and wandering plagues, seizing and confining them all.

May the sins of my seven generations of ancestors—those of the five rebellions, the countless transgressions, the offenses against Heaven and Earth, the unforgivable crimes—all be pardoned and absolved, their judgments resolved. May my seven generations of ancestors and thirty-six generations of forebears who died by the sword, in bonds, by official execution, in prison or the marketplace, or were crushed by wood or stone, or perished from festering sores, drowning, burning, or were left unburied in distant lands, each be interred according to their fate. If in moving homes, marrying, building dwellings, or other undertakings, my seven generations of ancestors and thirty-six generations of forebears violated the baleful stars or the inauspicious lunar mansions, acted against reason, encountered adversity, or offended the Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Black Tortoise, or Hook Star, or the eight divine prohibitions, bringing misfortune, or if their burials or relocations transgressed the Great General of Disaster—may all such offenses be resolved.

chunks.original_text: 太岁太阴，冲破劫杀。 五部刺奸，十二司命。 十二月建，五虚六耗。 天年岁星，宅中伏龙。 七狱吏，井灶之神。 青龙白虎，朱雀玄武，六合勾陈。 天后所居，天空天一，功曹传送，太一登明，天刚从魁，河魁大吉，小吉斗加。 阴阳四面，注杀声尸六害。 高功卑功，天功地功，水功土功，金功木功。 时恶之鬼，讼考之殃。 青功赤功，白功黑功黄功。 天赀地赀，青赀赤赀，黄赀白赀黑赀。 覆水污池，零林之鬼。 营传符庙，饮食之鬼。 杀生血食爱钱，邪浊不正之神。 山林孟长，十二溪女。 男孟女孟，大孟小孟，青孟赤孟，白孟黑孟黄孟。 百猎鬼行，破杀下官。 故气山川庙祠，众邪鬼神，祈梼咒诅。 天祷地祷，大祷小祷。 南乡三考，司命大王。 立路之神，三皇五帝。 伏羲将军，自称五霸。 伐杀将军，天心太守。 九江大神，十二水帝。 五道将军，左右掾吏。 一切禁官，四海游猎。 道上行客，五虚六耗。 五毒凶吹，十二不媚之鬼。 春秋冬夏，清浊之气。 岁复月连，日复时连。 鬼贼盘结不去者，愿一切分别，随时解散四面咒诅。 黄帝五霸以来，坏军死将脱锋之鬼，光怪集聚，合为精祟。 崟石草木、虫鼠龙蛇、狐狸虎豹、乌雀众精，下官故气六甲六乙、六丙六丁、六戊六己、六庚六辛六壬六癸十二时上支干禁忌之鬼，共为精祟。 群辈相逐，皆共乘车，骑马步从。 鬼兵枸闭生人魂魄，残害天民，招唤死人。 七世父母三十六世以来，盟诅不了，地下相引，逮及生人。 不知某家七世父母死人，从何许来？ 姓族所由婚姻，悉何方人？ 死亡之日，属何郡县何乡里？ 将作缘吏，为何姓名？ 皆属星官，为是何宿？ 角亢氏房心尾箕，青龙七星主之。 位属东方，甲乙，官青帝，岁星，木精。 主春正月、二月、三月，寅卯辰岁月日时。 始春，王相能消土精。 斗牛女虚危室壁，玄武七星主之。 位属北方，壬癸，黑帝，辰星，水精。 主冬十月、十一月、十二月，亥子丑。 始冬，王相能消火精。 奎娄胄勖毕赀参，白虎七星主之。 位属西方，庚辛，白帝，太白，金精。 主秋七月、八月、九月，申酉戌。 始秋，王相能消木精。 井鬼柳星张翼轸，朱雀七星主之。 位属南方，丙丁，赤帝，荧惑，火精。 主夏四月、五月、六月，巳午未。 始夏，王相能消金精。 □□□□□□□七星，位属中央，戊己，勾陈，镇星，土精。 分节，王相能消水精。 二十八宿，三十五官，死人所属诸官，天兵随事解释。 又恐某家先亡后死七祖父母，从无极世界以来，有诸犯触。 角宿三星，十二度。 二清二浊将，从二百七十人。 恶星当灭，复连当绝。 亢宿四星，九度。 一清三浊将，从三百五十人。 恶星当灭，复连当绝。 氏宿四星，十五度。 一清三浊将，从三百五十人。 恶星当灭，复连当绝。 房星四星，钩铁二星，合六星，五度。 一清二浊将，从一百五十人。 恶星当灭，复连当绝。 心宿三星，五度。 一清一浊将，从三百一十人。 恶星当灭，复连当绝。 尾宿九星，十八度。 一清二浊将，从一百二十五人。 恶星当灭，复连当绝。 箕宿四星，十二度。 一清一浊将，从三百九十人。 恶星当灭，复连当绝。 谨请东方九夷，九九八十一官君将，从兵士七十亿万众，一合来下。
