May the Year Star and Great Yin, the clashes and baleful stars, be resolved. The Five Divisions’ piercing deceits and the Twelve Life-Mandating Deities; the monthly establishments, the Five Deficiencies and Six Expenditures; the celestial Year Star and the hidden dragon within the dwelling; the seven prison wardens and the spirits of wells and hearths; the Green Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, Black Tortoise, Six Harmonies, and Hook Star; the abodes of the Heavenly Queen, Heavenly Void, Heavenly One, Merit Clerk, Messenger, Grand Unity, Ascending Brightness, Heavenly Rigidity, Follower, River Marshal, Great Auspice, and Lesser Auspice; the Dipper’s encroachment; the yin and yang on all four sides, the inscribed baleful influences, the clamorous corpses, and the Six Harmings; the high merits and low merits, the celestial merits and terrestrial merits, the water merits and earth merits, the metal merits and wood merits; the ghosts of inauspicious times and the calamities of litigation and torture; the green merits, red merits, white merits, black merits, and yellow merits; the celestial fines and terrestrial fines, the green fines, red fines, yellow fines, white fines, and black fines; the ghosts of spilled water and polluted pools, the ghosts of withered groves; the spirits of relay stations and talismanic temples, the ghosts of food and drink; those who delight in blood sacrifices and money, the impure and unrighteous deities; the Mountain and Forest Elders, the Twelve Stream Women; the Male Elders and Female Elders, the Greater Elders and Lesser Elders, the Green Elders, Red Elders, White Elders, Black Elders, and Yellow Elders; the hundred hunting ghosts on the move, the destructive and slaying subordinate officials; the residual qi of mountains, rivers, temples, and shrines, the myriad malevolent ghosts and deities, the supplications and curses; the celestial prayers and terrestrial prayers, the great prayers and small prayers; the Three Examinations of the Southern Village, the Life-Mandating Great King; the deities of crossroads, the Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors; the Fuxi General, who styles himself among the Five Hegemons; the Slaying General, the Celestial Heart Governor; the Great Deity of the Nine Rivers, the Twelve Water Emperors; the Five Paths General and his left and right aides; all the prohibiting officials and the roving hunters of the Four Seas; the travelers on the roads, the Five Deficiencies and Six Expenditures; the Five Poisons and baleful winds, the Twelve Unyielding Ghosts; the qi of spring, autumn, winter, and summer, both pure and turbid; the years overlapping months, the days overlapping hours; may all ghosts, bandits, and entanglements that linger be distinguished and, in accordance with the times, dispersed and dissolved on all four sides, along with the curses.

From the Five Hegemons of the Yellow Emperor onward, the ghosts of ruined armies and slain generals who escaped the blade, the strange apparitions that gather and coalesce into malevolent spirits; the essences of cliffs, stones, grasses, and trees, of insects, rats, dragons, and snakes, of foxes, tigers, leopards, and crows, the myriad essences; the subordinate officials and residual qi of the Six Jia, Six Yi, Six Bing, Six Ding, Six Wu, Six Ji, Six Geng, Six Xin, Six Ren, and Six Gui, the ghosts of the Heavenly Stems and Earthly Branches’ prohibitions in the twelve hours—may all such malevolent spirits, as they pursue one another, whether riding in chariots, on horseback, or on foot, be resolved. May the ghostly soldiers who bar the way and seize the souls of the living, harming the people of heaven, summoning the dead, and entangling the living through the unresolved oaths and curses of seven generations of parents and thirty-six generations of forebears, be dispersed.

From what place do the deceased seven generations of parents of this household come? What are their surnames and clans, and from which marriages do they derive? From which prefecture, county, village, and hamlet did they depart on the day of their death? What were the names of the officials who presided over their burials? To which stellar officials do they belong, and which constellations govern them?

The Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket—these Seven Stars of the Green Dragon govern them. Their position pertains to the East, to Jia and Yi, to the Green Emperor, the Year Star, and the essence of wood. They preside over the first, second, and third months of spring, the years, months, days, and hours of Yin, Mao, and Chen. At the onset of spring, when wood is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of earth.

The Dipper, Ox, Girl, Void, Danger, House, and Wall—these Seven Stars of the Black Tortoise govern them. Their position pertains to the North, to Ren and Gui, to the Black Emperor, the Chronographic Star, and the essence of water. They preside over the tenth, eleventh, and twelfth months of winter, the years, months, days, and hours of Hai, Zi, and Chou. At the onset of winter, when water is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of fire.

The Straddler, Harvester, Stomach, Net, Turtle, Hairy Head, and Triaster—these Seven Stars of the White Tiger govern them. Their position pertains to the West, to Geng and Xin, to the White Emperor, Venus, and the essence of metal. They preside over the seventh, eighth, and ninth months of autumn, the years, months, days, and hours of Shen, You, and Xu. At the onset of autumn, when metal is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of wood.

The Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wings, and Axletree—these Seven Stars of the Vermilion Bird govern them. Their position pertains to the South, to Bing and Ding, to the Red Emperor, Mars, and the essence of fire. They preside over the fourth, fifth, and sixth months of summer, the years, months, days, and hours of Si, Wu, and Wei. At the onset of summer, when fire is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of metal.

The Seven Stars of [missing text] govern the Center, pertaining to Wu and Ji, to the Hook Star, Saturn, and the essence of earth. They preside over the intercalary months, and when earth is in its prime, it can dissolve the essence of water.

The twenty-eight lunar mansions and thirty-five stellar officials to which the deceased belong—may the celestial soldiers resolve their entanglements in accordance with the circumstances.

Moreover, it is feared that the deceased ancestors and seven generations of parents of this household, from the Boundless Realm onward, may have committed offenses against the following:

The Horn Mansion, three stars, twelve degrees. Two pure and two turbid generals, accompanied by 270 soldiers. The baleful stars are to be extinguished, and their lingering connections severed.

The Neck Mansion, four stars, nine degrees. One pure and three turbid generals, accompanied by 350 soldiers. The baleful stars are to be extinguished, and their lingering connections severed.

The Root Mansion, four stars, fifteen degrees. One pure and three turbid generals, accompanied by 350 soldiers. The baleful stars are to be extinguished, and their lingering connections severed.

The Chamber Mansion, four stars, with the Hook and Iron stars (six in total), five degrees. One pure and two turbid generals, accompanied by 150 soldiers. The baleful stars are to be extinguished, and their lingering connections severed.

The Heart Mansion, three stars, five degrees. One pure and one turbid general, accompanied by 310 soldiers. The baleful stars are to be extinguished, and their lingering connections severed.

The Tail Mansion, nine stars, eighteen degrees. One pure and two turbid generals, accompanied by 125 soldiers. The baleful stars are to be extinguished, and their lingering connections severed.

Should the pestilential afflictions of the five directions, the Yellow Slave Brothers seventy-two in number, and the plague-bearing ghosts ride the wind and mount the sparrows, entering the homes of men to await their moments of weakness and seize their young, may all be gathered, severed, and banished ten thousand *li* away. Moreover, the *zhu* ghosts of the five directions, styling themselves Meng Tian, Chi Jing, Ji Liang, and Wang Zu, each leading a thousand men, enter homes to seize the young, bringing malarial fevers. Also, the malevolent ghosts of the five directions, calling themselves Wu Emperor, Han King, Wu Zixu, Duke of Zhou, and Great Ministers, specialize in causing abdominal distension. Further, *zhu* ghosts styling themselves ancient great kings and lords of the world’s great generals come to sicken and deceive men, falsely claiming kinship as elders, slaying the young, and filling homes with misfortune, illness, and calamity.

There is also a ghost king surnamed Yan, named Gaozi, who leads thirty thousand men to spread madness and wailing sickness. The *zhu* ghosts of the Five Emperors of the five directions, calling themselves Zhang Yuanbo, lead ten thousand ghosts to spread chills, fevers, and perverse malarial afflictions. The *zhu* ghosts of the five directions, styling themselves Jiao Dan and the Innocent Yang, lead three thousand ghosts to slay children. Another of the five directions’ killing ghosts, calling himself Liu Yuanda, leads seven hundred myriad ghosts to perpetrate seventy kinds of epidemics. Another ghost king, calling himself Zhong Shiji, leads six hundred myriad ghosts to cause five kinds of dysentery. Another ghost king, calling himself Zhao Gongming, leads thirty thousand ghosts to cause axe wounds in homes. Another ghost king, calling himself Shi Wenye, leads seventy-two myriad ghosts to cause death by swelling and qi. Another ghost king, surnamed Du and named Zhou, leads seventy myriad ghosts to preside over prison deaths. Another ghost king, surnamed Zong and named Wenhou, leads three thousand six hundred ghosts to cause fires. Another ghost king, calling himself Wu Wang Ghost, leads ten million ghosts to cause drowning deaths. Another ghost king, calling himself Tian Dao, leads seventy myriad ghosts to cause death by longing. Another ghost king, calling himself Wang Qian, Bai Qi, and Deng Ai’s ghosts, leads thirty thousand ghosts to spread myriad illnesses and kill men.

There is yet another ghost king, claiming to be the Great Spirit of the August Emperor, who enters homes to drive out household ghosts, demanding blood sacrifices, along with the ghosts of omens and portents, hunting and communal sacrifices, and the spirits of those who come seeking. I further invoke the Qiungqi, devourers of ghosts, seven hundred myriad in number, to descend together in succession and consume them, allowing none to escape.

Moreover, I, [Name], of high and low station in this household, declare: in this life’s encounter, I have been numbered among the Dao’s followers, yet I have failed to respond with devotion to the Dao, and my offenses have not been sufficiently prolonged. My household is not harmonious. Now, afflicted by illness and distress, I fear I cannot escape. I have heard that the great Dao succors all things; none who surrender themselves to it fail to receive its grace. Yet my original master is distant, and my pleas cannot reach him. Seeing that I share the same dharma as you, I hasten to welcome you to my home, beseeching a written petition to save and cure myself.

To you, who hold office and bear the beauty of the dharma’s qi, I declare my inability to fully proclaim the dharma’s power as I witness the calamities and distress of this household. With trepidation, I prostrate myself and humbly submit this petition, one document addressed to the Heavenly Courts, along with offerings to the Five Emperors. I beg the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Master, the Lineage Masters, the Three Masters, the Lady of the Gate, the Twenty-Four Worthies, the Twelve Perfected Saints, the Compassionate Father and Holy Mother, and the Lords of Qi, to bestow the Dao’s qi upon this household, to cover and clothe us in its grace.
